name: NewYorker
text: The diverse demonstrations of thousands taking place across the country represent “one of those rare moments in American history, a moment of white awakening” to the reality of black lives, a sociology professor said. https://t.co/mDfVi3DQNQ

name: NewYorker
text: It’s one thing for the N.F.L. to hear out its players, which can be done privately. But is it really going to start encouraging public speech? https://t.co/y62wygOqeg

name: NewYorker
text: "The fact that one acts nonviolently does not guarantee a nonviolent response," @BillMcKibben writes. "In fact, history indicates that it often guarantees the opposite." https://t.co/r9k5EiVsa0

name: NewYorker
text: Was one of psychology’s most controversial studies about individual fallibility or broken institutions? https://t.co/o674vbVjSe

name: NewYorker
text: The sound of live-streamed musical events is often tinny, the stage patter awkward—but their mere existence is bracing, and at times they achieve startling power. https://t.co/Oyhfh1H504

name: NewYorker
text: A company of actors, singers, writers, scientists, naturalists, and one polar guide are collaborating to create an online reading of Samuel Taylor Coleridge’s “Rime of the Ancient Mariner.” https://t.co/A7e58OEL5b

name: NewYorker
text: “If we’re just going to use solar power instead of coal to run the same sad mess of unfair and ugly oppression, is it really worth it?” @billmckibben on the protests taking place across the United States, and why we must face our collective demons. https://t.co/WUuHE7OdPI

name: NewYorker
text: “Trump has got to be defeated and, in a variety of ways, I intend to play an active role in that process.” An interview with Bernie Sanders. https://t.co/Jw8my3AsKm

name: NewYorker
text: Dexter Filkins reports from Iran, where public conﬁdence in the theocratic system, installed after the Iranian Revolution, in 1979, has collapsed. https://t.co/ikWt41darO

name: NewYorker
text: “Change does not happen overnight,” Bernie Sanders said. “It changes when political consciousness changes, it changes when millions of people get involved in the process and take to the streets.” https://t.co/H9fMmMf5x0

name: NewYorker
text: A cartoon by Elisabeth McNair. https://t.co/ia9Yb1Kf1T

name: NewYorker
text: After being diagnosed with cancer, Anne Boyer was treated with a chemical called cyclophosphamide—the medical version of mustard gas, which was outlawed in 1925. https://t.co/VwGTPQ58zj

name: NewYorker
text: “My mother warned me that if you choose to fall asleep during a time when people are seizing power, then the consequences of that are that you have to say, ‘I was part of America losing democracy.’ “ An interview with Tori Amos. https://t.co/CybP3oUPq5

name: NewYorker
text: “We don’t see no riot here, take off your riot gear,” a crowd of protesters chanted, gathered in front of a group of Seattle cops. Unprovoked, the cops showered them with tear gas, hurled flash-bangs, and chased thousands of peaceful protesters for blocks. https://t.co/ARIEiqxMFh

name: NewYorker
text: Zoos still have to feed and care for animals—nearly a million, from 6,000 species in the United States alone—at a time in which revenues have plummeted to nothing, the president of the Association of Zoos and Aquariums said. https://t.co/K0LmeHqbao

name: NewYorker
text:
Larry Kramer had the courage to act on his fear of tyranny, and to demand that others act with him.
https://t.co/RZtABcHLY1

name: NewYorker
text:
An E.R. doctor reflects on the adaptive techniques that medical professionals must use to work through the pandemic, and how COVID-19 cases can begin to feel typical, common, and part of a pattern.
https://t.co/Emyt5uNIR9

name: NewYorker
text:
Bryan Washington writes from a memorial in Houston, Texas, the city where George Floyd came of age, and where he is remembered as a light of his community.
https://t.co/u6voy6xRjU

name: NewYorker
text:
“Warning lights for democracy are flashing all over the dashboard,” Jeff Colgan said, after Donald Trump's response to the protests of George Floyd’s killing.
https://t.co/KcuKaswIXK

name: NewYorker
text: A new video, “Laments from Quarantine,” captures wails, songs, and chants of loss during the coronavirus pandemic, which has now killed at least 400,000 people worldwide. https://t.co/pyaIxqcIlP

name: NewYorker
text: A dispatch by @brywashing, from Houston, at the march with George Floyd’s family: "The diversity of the marchers can’t be overstated," Washington writes. "It was easy to see why Houston is routinely referred to as the most diverse city in the country." https://t.co/CbbYylNorG

name: NewYorker
text: "These past few days have shown, once again, that Donald Trump is in permanent burn-it-down mode," @sbg1 writes. https://t.co/YyBOtdKiK8
